III. 
Mount Vernon Project  
 
A. Project Background
The Mount Vernon Project11 will create a UTEN consisting of two loops, connected to
several geothermal borehole fields that will be installed in existing parking lots and greenspace.
The UTEN is designed to serve up to 76 buildings in a disadvantaged community, connected to
the network via heat pumps. Participants will range from residents of 1-4 family homes, a low-
income multifamily housing complex, small businesses, and community buildings. This project
presents the opportunity to retire a section of leak prone gas pipe by fully electrifying a row of
homes currently connected to that pipe and connecting them to the UTEN instead. The Mount
Vernon UTEN will inform construction of UTENs in light urban/suburban regions and the use of
geothermal boreholes as thermal resources within the Con Edison service territory.
